content.text:
# Analysis of Target Structure

## Main Target Image Description
The main image shows two separate structures on a dark checkered floor:

### Structure 1 (Left):
- A red rectangular base with two semi-circular indentations on top
- A blue cube placed on top of the left portion of the red base
- Total blocks: 2 (1 red base, 1 blue cube)
- Layers: 2 (base layer and top cube)

### Structure 2 (Right):
- A yellow base consisting of two connected half-cylinder shapes
- A green cube placed on the left side of the yellow base
- A blue cube placed on the right side of the yellow base
- Total blocks: 4 (2 yellow half-cylinders, 1 green cube, 1 blue cube)
- Layers: 2 (base layer and top cubes)

## Block Selection from Dictionary

Looking at the block dictionary, I can identify the following required blocks:

For Structure 1:
- Block #3: Red U-shaped block (left side of the base)
- Block #2: Red U-shaped block (right side of the base)
- Block #6: Blue cube (for the top)

For Structure 2:
- Block #11: Yellow half-cylinder (left side of the base)
- Block #12: Yellow half-cylinder (right side of the base)
- Block #7: Green cube (left top)
- Block #6: Blue cube (right top)

## Assembly Instructions

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 3
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 6
    Step4: Move block with index 11
    Step5: Move block with index 12
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 6
}
```

This assembly order places the bases first, followed by the top pieces, building each structure from left to right in the image.
